alert.note: Alert for Blaine (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 6:28PM MDT until further notice by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River near Harlem affecting Blaine County. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become high. For the Milk River...including Harlem...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Milk River near Harlem. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Escape routes for livestock may be cut off. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 PM MDT Saturday the stage was 23.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:30 PM MDT Saturday was 23.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will remain near or at moderate flood stage for the next several days. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.5 feet on 06/11/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued as needed or before Sunday morning at 1000 AM MDT.
